body.directions: Read each word or phrase in Chinese, and then answer the question that follows.

body.quiz: Which of the following pronouns can be used to address the person this word refers to?
body.correct: Job well done! 妈妈 māma means “mom,” and the pronoun 她 tā(she) is the right word to address her.
body.incorrect: Very close. First understand the meaning of the word; then consider which pronoun by gender correctly addresses the person the word refers to.

body.quiz: Which of the following does not fall in the same category as the word presented?
body.answer: Audio for 谢谢 xièxiè
options: Audio for 妈妈 māma
Audio for 姐姐 jiějie
Audio for 弟弟 dìdi
body.correct: Fantastic job! 爸爸 bàba (dad), 妈妈 māma (mom), 姐姐 jiějie (older sister), and 弟弟 dìdi (younger brother) are all titles used to address your family members, while 谢谢 xièxiè means "thanks."
body.incorrect: Oops... listen to the audios in the options again, all of which are “duplicated words” (words with the same character(s) repeating), and see if you can identify the one word that doesn’t belong.

body.quiz: Which of the following words can be used in similar conversations as the word presented?
body.correct: You got it! 儿子 érzi means “son,” which can be used in conversations introducing family members. The word 女儿 nü’ér (daughter) can also be used in such conversations.
body.incorrect: Not quite… think about the meaning of 儿子 érzi and what kind of conversation it can be used for. Then among the options, find the one that can also be used in the same conversations.

body.quiz: You can use the word presented in all of the following sentences except which one?
body.answer: 请给我两盘____。 Qǐng gěiwǒ liǎngpán ____.
options: 他有三个____。 Tā yǒu sāngè ____.
我是她的____。 Wǒ shì tāde ____.
body.correct: You got it! 孩子 háizi means “child,” and remember that in the Chinese language, you don’t need to change a noun for its plural. With the structures in the options, you can say “I like children,” “He has three children,” and “I am her child.” But you may not want to say, “Please, give me two plates of children.”
body.incorrect: Not quite… think about the meaning of 孩子 háizi and how you can reasonably fit it in the sentences in the options.
